intro: Hieracium hemitrichotum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium hemitrichotum is known for its resilience and ability to thrive in various environmental conditions.
